item.title: Pedestrian Light at the crossing between Woburn Place and Russle Square park, 1st July
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing light is always red. I had been there observing for more than 10 minutes. It did not change once. I filmed 6 mins of those as evidence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London

item.title: Van parked her no MOT, 1st July
item.description:
A van is parked in Holywell Close, no MOT and it has been parked in a place where a resident could park, it looks like there is all rubbish inside and been left there for a while. I have seen and increase number of people looking around the vehicle, I'm worried that it will increase crime especially if it has rubbish in the vehicle and no MOT. Could this be given notice of removal? I live on the estate and I need a space to park my car to make me feel safe. The van is white transit - registration number EF62ZRX. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Non recylable waste collection missed on 24th June, 1st July
item.description:
Much of the lower end of Star Lane is still awaiting a non-recyclable rubbish collection from last week. This was reported to you on the 25th June but nothing has happened. We are talking about a large number of tall green waste bins and stacked rubbish sacks. The foxes, crows, seagulls, rats and squirrels are having a field day with it and it's constantly requiring a tidy up and re-bagging. Why was this missed and why has my report on the 25th been ignored?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8B, Star Lane, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hi there , rubbish are on the pedestrians way and honestly is already more than 2 weeks . Is getting really bad and smelly . As everything is getting off or rotten. Please help us, 1st July
item.description:
The rubbish is being dumped and everyday is more . They posted a letter that says that the rubbish it will be collected in 48 hours but is already more than 2 weeks and no one get this issue done . Please the corner is getting awful and is very smelly . The things is getting off or rotten and is bad for the neighbourhood. Please help us to sort this issue . And penalised who ever is responsible of this matter . Thank you , Luis Manzi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62?, High Street, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
